image_analysis.description: A scanned image of a two-page spread from a printed book. The left page is partially visible, showing the end of lines of text. The right page is fully visible. The book's gutter and the curve of the pages are apparent. A document label is visible at the bottom of the image.
image_analysis.layout: Two-column layout corresponding to two pages of a book. The left page is numbered 180 and the right is 181. Each page has a header, a main body of text, and a page number at the bottom. A document identifier is located in the footer area of the overall image.

FILTHY RICH

of America’s most famous lawyers, and before long, another
celebrity lawyer—Ken Starr, the former solicitor general who
had had Bill Clinton impeached for perjury—would join Epstein’s
team.
   As far as Mary’s parents were concerned, their daughter had
walked into an ambush. Everyone in the courtroom seemed to be
playing defense on the side of Jeffrey Epstein. And as for the sec-
ond girl—Alison, who claimed that she had been raped—she
never testified in court at all.

document_metadata.subject: Account related to Jeffrey Epstein's legal case, involving victims named Mary and Alison, and his legal team.

notes: The document is an excerpt from a book titled 'FILTHY RICH'. The left page is partially cut off, so the beginning of each line is missing. The text discusses events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's legal proceedings, mentioning victims and members of his legal team.
